page.title: 11EVENTS IN DIPTON.
page.content: LEEK SHOWS by RICHARD McDERMOTT. {These are held annually in local pubs. {The show Leek is grown exclusively in {N.E.England.A good leek should be 6in. {from the button & its size is measured {in Cubic ins.12 leeks are grown in a {special trench,8ft.by 4ft. The Trench has 3 layers;1ft. of old horse manure,1ft.of fresh manure and 6ins. of soil, containing,blood fish & bone.Phostrogen is fed to the leeks once a week and the plants should be watered every second day, preferably with clean, rain water. {When lifting the leek for the show, {you must retain as much of the root {"beard" as possible.Tape should be {tied at the 1st.leaf joint &the leek {placed in a bucket of clean water {overnight,for the following day's show {First Prize in some shows can be as {much as one thousand pounds.
